Key Arguments: The Bill threatens freedom of speech and democratic rights by allowing the government to define truth.
The Bill imposes restrictions on online platforms but exempts the government and mainstream media, creating a double standard.
The Bill gives ACMA the power to determine misinformation and disinformation, which could lead to abuse of power.
The Bill could turn social media and internet companies into tools for government censorship.
The Bill promotes ideological conformity and suppresses dissenting voices, likening it to historical authoritarian regimes.
Notable Quotes: The Bill grants the Government the authority to define what is truth, allowing the Government to control and manipulate the flow of information.
The Bill paves the way for ideological conformity, suppressing dissenting voices and hindering independent thought.
Such approach fully reflects the policies implemented by the National Socialist Party in Germany during the 1930’s and 1940’s.
